website_summaries.verdict: All-natural type of orange oil that will biodegrade after use. Safe for all kinds of cleaning projects.
pros: Manufacturing process doesn't use any heating of the orange peel, which protects the consistency of the oil
Works for all kinds of cleaning situations
When used at certain concentration levels, it repels insects successfully
cons: Quality control occasionally is a problem, as the bottle sometimes arrives cracked or bent

customer_reviews.title: Great Stuff
customer_reviews.text: I've used Medina Orange Oil for years and I use it on just about everything....spray it on my counter tops to deter ants....pour it on the fire ant mounds to encourage them to move on....spray it on my dust mop, leaves a wonderful scent....use it just like lemon oil on my furniture....and so on
customer_reviews.author: Glenda Ruggles

customer_reviews.title: Didn't do what I purchased the item for ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this natural orange oil after reading reviews on how it kept feral cats out of people's yards. It was quite expensive and I actually mixed 8 oz instead of the 4 oz in 2 gallons of water so that it was stronger on first application. I sprayed the entire perimeter of my property outside the fence (1/2 acre!) and the very next day, there was cat poop in the back yard! Ugh! Definitely did not do the trick. My yard smells lovely but it definitely doesn't keep cats away.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie A. Cunha

customer_reviews.title: Very useful product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this orange oil to help ward off stray (feral) cats that like to sit on my patio furniture. This is a humane and kind way to accomplish that, plus my furniture smells so good! I have since found many other uses for this oil. It seemed pricey to me, but then I realized that this is more of a concentrate, and it is meant to be diluted.
customer_reviews.author: CA Chickadee

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is the bee's knees
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is the best termite-ant-spider killing/repelling and cleaning stuff available. It is astonishing in its efficacy. We put it into syringes to inject into termite galleries and spray it on ants and get 100% kill and effective repelling action. We wipe it or spray it on outdoor lamps and it repels spiders and their webs for months and months. Cleaning kitchen counters with it is fantastic as it cleans like mad, especially greasy or sticky stuff. And it smells terrific. And doesn't hurt you. Amazing stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Great natural insecticide and cleaner.
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product. It can be used in many applications and in my case it was used to control ants in my garden bed. Not only did it completely wipe out the ants, but it also killed the spiders, caterpillars, wasps and stink bugs. It’s important to know that you will need to use multiple applications, on a weekly to bi-weekly bases, and you’ll want to treat your garden in the evening after sun down to prevent burning.
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: Cleans up!
customer_reviews.text: I love this orange cleaner. It really gets the job done! I have used it to kill ants on contact and for getting gum out of my dog's hair when he sat on some gum someone threw on the ground. It cleans my kitchen counters, floors, microwave and whatever I need to clean. It is more economical to use than other store purchased cleaners.
customer_reviews.author: BECKY BW

customer_reviews.title: Bad packaging
customer_reviews.text: The packaging of this item was not done very well. It came in a bubble pack bag not in a box. Before I had even open the bag I could already smell the product. After I open the bag seen the product was in a thin clear plastic bag and some of the liquid in the bottom of the clear bag. When I had taken it out of the original packing bag I had some of the liquid on my hands with a very strong orange smell. Still checking it out to see if there is a hole on the bottle or it just leaked out of the cap.
customer_reviews.author: Delia Simas

customer_reviews.title: Actually works for fireants!
customer_reviews.text: Read about this stuff for killing fire ants. I have 2 small dogs and don't want to use anything that could make them sick, so decided to give it a try. Well, 24 hours after treating many mounds in my yard, there is not one ant to be found. Kicking a mound usually results in a boiling mess of pissed off fire ants looking to attack anything in the way, but not this morning! This was fire ant genocide! Only thing it didn't completely eradicate was a stubborn mound of bull ants, so that will get a retreat and we'll see what happens.
customer_reviews.author: gpisces

customer_reviews.title: I looked up the msds. The emulsifier are terpene ...
customer_reviews.text: I looked up the msds. The emulsifier are terpene compounds, which are naturally found in trees such as pine. It's what gives thise trees their characteristic smell.
customer_reviews.author: Drake Tran

customer_reviews.title: and it did a great job mixed with 205 vinegar to kill the weeds ...
customer_reviews.text: The oil arrived very quickly, and it did a great job mixed with 205 vinegar to kill the weeds in my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Dovichin

customer_reviews.title: I love the smell but my cats don't!
customer_reviews.text: I love this oil. It smells great but my cats hate the smell. That is exactly why I bought it. To keep them out of an area that they decided to make the new litter area without my permission.
customer_reviews.author: Annakatinka

customer_reviews.title: good all around the house and yard
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to rid our yard of fire ants . This can be used with liquid soap and water to help with insect problems with no harm to plants or pets. You get a large bottle and you only need a ounce or so for most of your projects so it is also good for your wallet.
customer_reviews.author: vk

customer_reviews.title: It freaking worked!
customer_reviews.text: Alright I bought this combat the fire ants that were invading my mother in law's garden. It freaking worked!!! 4 gallons of the orange oil mixture and they are gone. I dare those little turds to come back. Also this will make your yard smell like oranges... not orange blossoms but oranges. Good stuff will buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Insect killer and repellent
customer_reviews.text: We have been using it around the house and sheds to kill spiders, ants and other insects. So far it is working when mixed with 1 teaspoon dish washing soap and 2 ounces of orange oil per gallon of water. We have black widow spiders and this kills them and keeps other insects our for a couple of months. You need to reapply along the perimeter of each building. Plus it is organic and smells great.
customer_reviews.author: R C

customer_reviews.title: Keeps mosquitoes away
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Have used this for at least the past 5 years as a spray to keep mosquitoes away from me. Just put a capful in a pint spray bottle of water and spray myself. Also I put a capful in the washer when washing my dogs sheets, etc. Works great and I smell like an orange 😄.
customer_reviews.author: M Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money and very consentrated
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff and it’s a huge bottle for the money. Most others are 1/4th this size. Will last for a long time - I use daily and it lasts me about a year because you only need a little bit. Makes everything smell great and I mop with it daily.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy In Fort Worth

customer_reviews.title: Orange Oil To Stop Fire Ants !!
customer_reviews.text: I saw this on a blog from a prepper that had terrible fire ant problems and I thought well, if it works for him maybe it will work for my fire ant problem. And it did !!! Thanks Sandy H
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Hatton

customer_reviews.title: No additives
customer_reviews.text: Use this for organic gardening. Tried a few other orange oil products and found waxy like stuff left behind after using in a mixing sprayer and a lot of it. The other I tried I am not sure what they added to the oil. Use this if you are wanting a real 100% orange oil without "extras".
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Schneiderwent

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I used this stuff to stop kittens from going to the bathroom on my bed.
customer_reviews.author: Senior Slimey

customer_reviews.title: orange oil
customer_reviews.text: i bought it to kill ants i saw on youtube and it really does the job, its the real stuff. amazon sellers are about the only place i shope
customer_reviews.author: mack sc beach bum

customer_reviews.title: Potent stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Came wrapped in a bag to prevent leaking. Great product! We use it to kill ants without harming pets. Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: dpoint

customer_reviews.title: Smells nice.
customer_reviews.text: Very useful in different applications. I mainly use it for cleaning. It's very concentrated and can last a while depending on your usage. This is my second bottle.
customer_reviews.author: John k

customer_reviews.title: Natural effective Pest Control
customer_reviews.text: This product works great when diluted to rid the house of spiders and then the house smells delicious so I have only good things to say about this product I love using natural methods of pest control
customer_reviews.author: Kiddo247

customer_reviews.title: Kills Fire Ants
customer_reviews.text: Mix 1.5 oz. with 3oz. Dawn dishwashing liquid in 1 gallon of water and saturate fire ant mound with entire gallon they will be dead within a week. The Orange Oil dissolves their exoskeleton. Read about this in Mother Earth News. It is great to have a product that is non poisionous to get rid of these ants.
customer_reviews.author: R Secrest

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Garden Ants!
customer_reviews.text: Worked exactly as planned in my organic garden. The ants couldn't handle this level of organic warfare.
customer_reviews.author: Ricarda

customer_reviews.title: Natural ant killer
customer_reviews.text: I saw a YouTube video using orange oil to naturally kill ants, so I decided to give it a try, especially after my dog got into an ant bed. Worked like a charm and didnt harm my dog or grass.
customer_reviews.author: TiaMia

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: It smells very nice but it just doesn't work not even full strength, I tried it on some greasy dishes full strength and doesn't cut the grease at all. It didn't get rid of the grease on the kitchen range either. Don't understand why it has such good reviews
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Even better price!!! Can’t find this stuff anywhere near me.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Use it in my yard to repel feral cats and keep my wild birds safe. Seems to help and it's non toxic.
customer_reviews.author: Snorkel Lady

customer_reviews.title: ... for fire ants in yard where the dogs are—-Working great!
customer_reviews.text: Used this to mix up for fire ants in yard where the dogs are—-Working great !
customer_reviews.author: Debby Divich

customer_reviews.title: Fights Fire ants
customer_reviews.text: I use the orange oil mixed with dishwashing liquid to get rid of Fire Ants.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Keeling-Holt

customer_reviews.title: Worked GREAT! Thanks
customer_reviews.text: Husband mixed with dishwashing detergent & put on fireants.Worked GREAT! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: ABD

customer_reviews.title: not sure this is really working
customer_reviews.text: It smells great and chases the ants from one location to another, but it doesn't really seem to kill the ants...even with dish soap added.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Helped with ants and keeping beetles away. Also good on mirrors and floors.
customer_reviews.author: Kara Choyce

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic cleaner
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never used this for insecticide only for cleaning. It’s very powerful and gets the job done! We just removed extremely sticky wall paper trim from our travel trailer and this was the ONLY product that took the goo off.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great cleaner
customer_reviews.text: Wanted this product for a cleaner and future bug repellent. Am a strong believer in citrus and this product fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Vickstrom

customer_reviews.title: Nice smell!
customer_reviews.text: I love the smell of this product, I spray it all around the outside of my house, red ants go away safely!! Keeping those creepy crawlers away for good!!
customer_reviews.author: DJ's Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Many great uses
customer_reviews.text: Used the orange oil to kill the ants and aphids on my corn stalks. It required multiple applications but worked without burning the corn. However even a mild solution burned the leaves on my pumpkin vines where it evidently pooled on the leaves.
customer_reviews.author: Bill McClure

customer_reviews.title: Good value, works great on fireants in my vegetable garden!
customer_reviews.text: Dilute a few ounces with several gallons of water and some dishsoap to drench fire ant mounds, and repeat a few days later if any signs of life remain. It will kill all the bugs, so be aware of your beneficial insects.
customer_reviews.author: kmd

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works great!!! Great for natural ant repellent and cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: DBosch

customer_reviews.title: Orange oil
customer_reviews.text: Product is good and it arrived quickly and packaged well. Very useful for home and garden wish it was a bit cheaper so 4/5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Borealis Rex

customer_reviews.title: Medina Orange Oil
customer_reviews.text: I use Medina Orange Oil all the time to control fire ants. I mix it with water and use it in mounds located in garden beds. It is safe to use in garden beds. I do not put it on vegetable plants, just on any ant mounds that may show up in the beds. If you need to get rid of the pests very quickly to prevent damage, I use a small amount of pure orange oil. Excellent product that I have used for several years. I would higly recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Nitengail

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: I mix the orange oil with 20% vinegar for use as a weed killer.
customer_reviews.author: Harry S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product!! Used to kill fire ants. Smells so good will look for other usages.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fire Ant Deterrent
customer_reviews.text: Used this product on fire ant hills around my yard and they disappeared! Don't know if it killed them or they just didn't like the nice citrus smell of this.
customer_reviews.author: Anitra Newcomb

customer_reviews.title: Fire Ant Killer iIngredient
customer_reviews.text: Great for my fire ant concoction to kill them dead NATURALLY! No chemicals needed! Find the concoction on Texas A&M website...Googe natural fire ant remedies!
customer_reviews.author: Ma Bell

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Can be used in a number of ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Can be used in a number of different ways. It deodorizes your home as you clean with it. I also use it on my plants
customer_reviews.author: elci p

customer_reviews.title: Safe & effective
customer_reviews.text: Well packaged. Easy to use. Effective against fire ants and other pests without harm to beneficial bees.
customer_reviews.author: Judy N.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome 💜
customer_reviews.text: Love this orange oil!!! I use it for cleaning with our clouder of cats💜

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Smelled great! Used to kill fire ants. Seemed to work!
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: We are using the orange oil as a killer for asps( a horrible stinging insect) on our fruit trees. If you kill them with pesticides, you also kill the predators. The orange oil is safe and effective. Awesome!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Watters

customer_reviews.title: Side Effects
customer_reviews.text: Does kill fire ants, however it also kills the grass.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still the best
customer_reviews.text: This is probably my 6th re-order of Orange Oil. Works every time and smells great. What more can you ask.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Love.
customer_reviews.text: Use this for bug control and cleaning (diluted with either rubbing alcohol or water) Love the smell of citrus.
customer_reviews.author: Cece

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I use it for ant repellant and boy does it work! Raid has nothing on this stuff!. Also makes my garbage disposal smell great
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Seaton

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Smells terrific and used as directed took care of my ant problem.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie C Cox

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Used for fire ant mounds. Works great mixing with dawn.
customer_reviews.author: debbie shelby

customer_reviews.title: This is GREAT Stuff!
customer_reviews.text: This orange oil is Terrific! I use it for everything from weed spray to kitchen cleaning to washload additive. Yes, the cost for a quart appears to be a little pricey, but in Every application, you only use a very small amount, e.g., a capful. And just wait until you find out the Wonderful scent that it will give your kitchen and your wash...
customer_reviews.author: lanczos

customer_reviews.title: I like this oil for its ability to make wood shine
customer_reviews.text: I like this oil for its ability to make wood shine. It also takes care of insects. I put about 1/2 oz. in a 8oz spray bottle with h20 and sprayed the back porch, heavily around light fixtures, keeps insects away for weeks on end., not harmful to people like aerosol sprays.
customer_reviews.author: Rocketbob

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We purchase and use medina orange oil from this company and are very happy with their product. It looks like high quality oil sbdvwutking well in our application process. We will continue to purchase this product through Amazon .com
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J.

customer_reviews.title: Fire ant treatment
customer_reviews.text: It was effective against fire ants but sometimes required more than one application.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works fantastic in the veggie garden for getting rid of mites and biggues
customer_reviews.author: D Haywood

customer_reviews.title: Helps kill ants
customer_reviews.text: We used this to kill the ants in our yard. It really works!
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: The ants didn't just move around like they do when we pour gas on the mounds ...
customer_reviews.text: So Texas AM recommened a formulation of this stuff, dawn and water to kill fire ants. I took a chance and tried it! IT TOTALLY WORKS. The ants didn't just move around like they do when we pour gas on the mounds (which kills the grass and makes me super nervous as a mom with little kiddos) they are gone. Gone I tell you. Literally all of my neighbors have ordered this and now their yard is fire ant free as well. I'm sure it's great for cleaning, but now that our yard is free of fire ants we're outside way more so the house isn't a priority!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki J.

customer_reviews.title: this was a good price buying here compared to other places with it ...
customer_reviews.text: Im using it in my gardening needs for fire ant control... not sure yet at the final result, time will tell, but i made it 4 stars instead of 5 because of the price of orange oil, this was a good price buying here compared to other places with it for sale, but just that orange oil should be cheaper everywhere its sold,
customer_reviews.author: DSWhite

customer_reviews.title: It makes everything smell so good.
customer_reviews.text: I got it for the yard ,but I use it inside for cleaning and the laundry .It makes everything smell so good.
customer_reviews.author: Louise J.

customer_reviews.title: Medina Orange Oil
customer_reviews.text: Good product that has many uses. Use it in our flower beds and we use it in the house for scent purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Kimery

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for and good size
customer_reviews.text: Got this orange oil to add with vinegar and dish soap in a sprayer for weeds and works! Also got it to spray ant trails outside and again, works! I don't mind the ants outside, I just don't want them in the house so I spray the trails leading to the foundation of the house and keeps them away. I never liked using poisons and this smells nice too. I learned that orange oil when sprayed on ants takes away their waxy protection and kills them. It works fast from what I've seen. Of course you spray one trail and they make another but over time, they get the hint.
customer_reviews.author: Love Amazon

customer_reviews.title: The fragrance wasn't strong enough.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for a stronger scent - could barely smell the orange. I won't reorder. I'd read good reviews so took a chance....
customer_reviews.author: Diane Ticks!

customer_reviews.title: A bigger dose is probably needed.
customer_reviews.text: I'm trying to chase away carpenter bees. This is supposed to do the job. It didn't. Next time I fill the sprayer I will use double the amount recommended and see if that works. I'm far too patient
customer_reviews.author: Virginia V. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: I have used Medina Orange Oil for many years with ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used Medina Orange Oil for many years with the companion garden molasses for fire ants. It is quite effective. I have less and less ants each year to treat and I do not worry about pets and wildlife in my yard. I also use with vinegar to make a spray for spiders.
customer_reviews.author: Littlebirdie

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this hoping it would work as a natural ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hoping it would work as a natural ant killer. It does kill them on contact but does not repel.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Segee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Smells wonderful and the wasps, ants and spiders hate it.

customer_reviews.title: great solution.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works on fire ant mounds in your garden. I have used it before mixing it with water and a little dish soap. great solution.
customer_reviews.author: glen e struchtemeyer

customer_reviews.title: Bottle leaked all over box
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice product and smells great, but the packaging was terrible- half of the product leaked out during shipping and the box it arrived in was saturated by the product. I also did not find the product effective for the purpose I bought it- deterring ants. It smells really nice though.
customer_reviews.author: P. G. P.

customer_reviews.title: Medina Orange Oil used for killing FIre Ants
customer_reviews.text: We use Medina Orange Oil to kill Fire Ants which move into our yard and bite us. Pouring Medina Orange Oil on ant piles has wiped out several of these pests. We will continue to use it as the Fire Ants move in.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa B.

customer_reviews.title: exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: making "homemade" weed/plant killer - this was the missing ingredient at a good price. Shipped fast - only set-back was the $4.00 duty they wanted and the Canadian Postal Service added $10.00 to collect the $4.00 - and to top it off they only accepted Cash ! By the way - the Homemade - all natural weed/grass/plant killer works great - everything I sprayed it on died in 5 to 7 days !
customer_reviews.author: Robert McRae

customer_reviews.title: Not good for insects...
customer_reviews.text: If it does'nt get direct contact, even, ants will not die..
customer_reviews.author: Misook Kim

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: this mixed with dawn soap was supposed to get rid of fire ants. It does not bother them.
customer_reviews.author: William D Blickenstaff

customer_reviews.title: Won't stop cats.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping that as advertised it would keep cats off my outdoor furniture. Didn't work at all. Might be good for ants,bugs etc. Won't work for cats as far as I can tell. Wasted my money. Fortunately it's not expensive
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Dave

customer_reviews.title: I also found it strange that it leaked from the original bottle from what seemed like osmosis, as we couldn't find anything wron
customer_reviews.text: We tried to use this in a diluted form with other chemicals to make a generic form of " Roundup " , but did not find it effective. I also found it strange that it leaked from the original bottle from what seemed like osmosis, as we couldn't find anything wrong with the bottle ! It may be effective for other means , and its the best price for the volume for all the places I checked,, it just didn't work in my application

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a cat detergent. Did not work at all for this purpose.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well at all
customer_reviews.text: Ants moved one foot away and built again. I wouldn't waste my time or money on this for pest control.

customer_reviews.title: Not d-lionene
customer_reviews.text: It could not disolve what I needed it to and after further research I found that d-limonene is actually a clear liquid. This oragne stuff might have d-limonene in it, but not at high enough concentrations for my uses. It does smell nice though.
customer_reviews.author: SweaterBumps4Life

customer_reviews.title: it did not work for us
customer_reviews.text: we ended up with more of orange scented ants at the end of the day. we followed the instructions but the product was ineffective.
customer_reviews.author: MamaBear

customer_reviews.title: Far too strong a sent for me to use. ...
customer_reviews.text: Far too strong a sent for me to use. I placed it in its own container and threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Sarina

customer_reviews.title: re just not feeling like hot tea - you're not HUNGRY but you could ...
customer_reviews.text: Add boiling water and yay SOUP! When it's cold and you;re just not feeling like hot tea - you're not HUNGRY but you could eat - when you need an
customer_reviews.author: Lhiannon

customer_reviews.title: Easy ant repellent
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how effective this was to repel ants. I have a leaky old farmhouse so "seal the cracks to keep them out" is not going to work. I put some orange oil on cotton balls every few feet on the countertop, and over the next three days, the number of ants I saw tapered off to nothing. Using cotton balls is a much easier method than spraying. I will probably need to refresh them periodically, but I don't have to think about it much. (Note - I set the cotton balls on bottle caps in case the oil might stain the counter.)
customer_reviews.author: PLD

customer_reviews.title: This orange oil is the best that I've used
customer_reviews.text: This orange oil is the best that I've used ! It cleans without harmful chemical additives and leaves a clean orange smell as a bonus. I use it to treat my small dogs for fleas and ticks. I dilute it in water along with equal amounts of vinegar and use it as a spray on application at bathtime. Then I rinse the dogs with clear clean water and then lightly apply the mixture afterwards as a preventative measure against further attack...LOL So far, this has worked well even during peak flea and tick season here in Southern California .
customer_reviews.author: Randy Goad

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: For more uses than you think! I LOVE THIS PRODUCT,WAS ABLE TO REMOVE EVEN PAINT OFF SOME OF MY CLOTHING, Try it I"m not kidding, put some on area where paint have gotten on your clothes rub it a bit, rinse and repeat until all pain is gone then wash clothing as normal. Put a bit in mopping rinse water keeps house smelling fresh.. I just came back to order another bottle but oh my goodness this price has really gone up.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Young Thing

customer_reviews.title: Great product but leaking every time on arrival.
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It does seem to really kill the fire ants. Sometimes it takes 2 times to kill a large mound. However what I don't like is that I have bought it twice and both times it had leaked about 2 ounces out of the bottle on arrival. Comes in plastic bags in the box so didn't leak outside but did leak in the plastic. It is expensive so to lose 2 ounces is not good! Notified customer service and have not heard a thing from them in a month.
customer_reviews.author: linda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, all natural solution to fire ants
customer_reviews.text: Read about this product on a few university websites so I thought I would try it out on a large infestation of fire ants near my driveway. Dude....IT WORKS!.... 1oz of Orange Oil, 1 tbs dawn dishsoap, pot of hot water. It took 2 applications but it took care of the mound and the ants haven't been back. I will say that the hot water killed the grass, but that is already growing back... Excellent by product of oranges...
customer_reviews.author: Public name

customer_reviews.title: good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Just got it yesterday but it doesn't work as well as a similarly proceed oil that is only 16 ounces. Though this one seems to make things more orange color when I spray it on them. I use it for ant control mostly and it does a great job of that. Hopefully I remember to come back and tell how long. The 16 oz other brand lasted all summer long.
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: Red Ant Killer Naturally
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to kill red ants in my backyard. 1 oz. of orange oil mixed with 1 gallon of hot tap water. I waited until dusk and lower temps to treat the red ant mounds. I did have to repeat the treatment in a couple of areas, but I'm happy to report that currently there are no active mounds and it did not damage the lawn.
customer_reviews.author: A. L. B.

customer_reviews.title: Well packaged and Delivered quickly - it is protected from leaking
customer_reviews.text: It has a pretty strong odor and it would be great if it had a spray option along with the plastic bottle - it cost a dollar an ounce $32.00 for 32 ounces - so far it seems to work for the purpose of my wood floors. If it changes, then I will update this review.
customer_reviews.author: C. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Good against cats
customer_reviews.text: To keep neighbor's cats from coming to our porch and dumping fleas, we spray a diluted version of this to deter them and it helps!
customer_reviews.author: YWU

customer_reviews.title: It killed my fire ants.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a safe product to kill fire ants in a graved run where I have four show dogs. Obviously it couldn't be anything poison. I mixed up a batch of Medina Orange Oil, Dawn Dish Detergent and Hot Water and poured it over the Fire Ants nest. It worked like a charm!!
customer_reviews.author: Joyce A. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Great scent when used as a cleaning agent.
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this good to keep bugs out if your garden, but if you mop with it and wipe window sills then it keeps your home pest free. great for getting rid of ants while adding a pleasant citrus smell to your home.
customer_reviews.author: Redlynn

customer_reviews.title: Used for fire ants.
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a recommendation from a friend to put on fire ant mounds and it worked!!! I have dogs and didn't want to use a pesticide. Did the trick!
customer_reviews.author: microsoftfree

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stuff
customer_reviews.text: I have started using orange oil for so many things around my house. The orange aroma isn’t too powerful. I will definitely order again when I run out.
customer_reviews.author: Musicmamma

product_meta.title: Orange Oil - 32 Fluid Ounce
product_meta.description: MEDINA Orange Oil contains the raw oil collected from the citrus peel during juice extraction. No heat is applied during this cold pressed process thereby preserving the integrity of the oil. Orange Oil has been discovered to be an important ingredient in a variety of household and gardening applications. Orange Oil degrades the waxy coating on the ectoskeleton of insects, causing dehydration and asphxiation. INGREDIENTS: Cold pressed orange peel extract, emulsifier. DIRECTIONS FOR MIXING: SHAKE WELL BEFORE MIXING! Foliar Solution: Mix 2 ounces per gallon of water. Soil Drench: Mix 4 ounces per gallon of water. Cleaning Solution: Mix 2 ounces per gallon of water. DIRECTIONS FOR USE: SHAKE WELL BEFORE USE. Diluted Solutions can be used as a natural adjuvant to assist other sprays and soil applications. The Original Orange Oil.
